tool.name: DropColumnsByName

param.name: input1
param.label: Select a suitable input file from your history

param.name: job_name
param.label: Supply a name for the outputs to remind you what they contain

param.name: input_cut
param.label: Selects (cuts out) specified columns name from the input-dataset (e.g., name1,name2)

validator.message: No API_KEY is available for the input text form

configfiles.configfile:
library("stringr")
cat("DropColumnsByName Started......\n") cat("\n")
ourargs = commandArgs(TRUE) inf = ourargs[1] input_cut = ourargs[2] outf = ourargs[3] cat("input file name:");inf cat("input cutting column name:");input_cut cat("output file name:");outf cat("\n")
outp = read.table(inf, sep="\t", comment.char = "", header=T) ncol(outp) trim = str_trim(unlist(strsplit(input_cut, ","))) trim outp = outp[, !(colnames(outp) %in% trim)] ncol(outp) write.table(outp, outf, quote=FALSE, sep="\t",row.names=F)
cat("....All Done. End of Script\n")

tool.help:
**What it Does**
**Script** Pressing execute will run the following code over your input file and generate some outputs in your history::
library("stringr")
cat("DropColumnsByName Started......\n") cat("\n")
ourargs = commandArgs(TRUE) inf = ourargs[1] outf = ourargs[2] cat("input file name:");inf cat("output file name:");outf cat("\n")
outp = read.table(inf, sep="\t", comment.char = "", header=T) ncol(outp) teststr = "mES_EBI141225_C04, mES_EBI141225_D04, PrE_EBI141225_A01 , PrE_EBI141225_A03, PrE_EBI141225_B03 " trim = str_trim(unlist(strsplit(teststr, ","))) trim outp = outp[, !(colnames(outp) %in% trim)] ncol(outp) write.table(outp, outf, quote=FALSE, sep="\t",row.names=F)
cat("....All Done. End of Script\n")
